sentences.en: Bertha Dorset ruined herself by an open falsehood.
sentences.cn: 白莎·多森用公开的谎言毁了自己的一生.

sentences.en: Falsehood like a nettle stings those who meddle with it.
sentences.cn: 谎言似荨麻,玩弄会刺手.

sentences.en: He could not and would not hint at any such falsehood.
sentences.cn: 他决不能,也不会暗示有这类捏造的事.

sentences.en: His story was replete with falsehood.
I am greased with falsehood and treachery.
sentences.cn: 我全身都涂满了虚假和不忠实的润滑油.

sentences.en: Saunders is deliberately telling a falsehood.
She called the verdict a victory of truth over falsehood.
sentences.cn: 她将这一判决称为真理对谬误的胜利。

sentences.en: Since he did not want to hurt his brother's feelings, he told a falsehood and said he didn't know.
sentences.cn: 由于他不想使他弟弟伤心, 就撒个谎,说他不知道.

sentences.en: They brought an accusation of falsehood against him.
to test the truth or falsehood of her claims
Truth is so obscure in these times, and falsehood so established.
sentences.cn: 目前的时代,真理是那样晦暗不明, 谎言又是那样根深蒂固.

sentences.en: Truth stands in opposition to falsehood.
Truth, if exaggerated, may become falsehood.
sentences.cn: 真理如加以夸张, 可能成为谬误.
